item.title: The World Health Organization has declared the Ebola outbreak a global public health emergency
item.description:
The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the West African Ebola outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) on August 8th. As of August 4, 2014, there were 1,711 cases (1,070 confirmed, 436 probable, and 205 suspected) of Ebola virus disease (EVD), resulting in 932 deaths. Between August 5th and 6th, 2014, 68 new EVD cases (including confirmed, probable, and suspected) and 29 deaths were reported across Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria, and Sierra Leone...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-world-health-organization-has-declared-the-ebola-outbreak-a-global-public-health-emergency/

item.title: GoPhones For Hurricane Gustav
item.description:
During the preparations for Hurricane Gustav, AT&T gave out over 2,000 GoPhones with $15 of pre-loaded airtime to Gulf Coast evacuees. This act of generosity brought attention to the GoPhone and its potential use as an emergency phone. AT&T’s GoPhone isn’t a specific phone model but a prepaid cellular service. Unlike traditional cell phone plans that require contracts and monthly fees regardless of usage, GoPhone lets you pay for airtime in advance...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/gophones-for-hurricane-gustav/
